    • Constructor Detail

      • GameController

        public GameController()

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGame

        public static void initializeGame(java.lang.String player1name,
                                  java.lang.String player2name,
                                  boolean isPVE)
        call this method to initialize the game controller. This method should only be called on the initial game setup.
        Parameters:
        player1name - is a string value that represents the username for player 1
        player2name - is a string value that represents the username for player 2
        isPVE - is a bolean that indicates if the controller should enter PVE mode, if so boolean value should be true. Otherwise false for PvP mode.

      • getRoundCount

        public int getRoundCount()
        Call this method to get the current value for the number of rounds that have been played. The round currently in session is not included in this value.
        Returns:
        roundCount of type int representing the number of rounds that have been played prior to the current round being played.

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()
        Call this method to get the current instance of the game object.
        Returns:
        game object instance of type Game.

      • setGame

        public void setGame(Game toGame)
        call this method to set an instance of Game object to this variable called game.
        Parameters:
        toGame - a reference to an instance of an object of type Game.

      • setRoundCount

        public static void setRoundCount(int toRoundCount)
        Call this method to set the value for roundCount, which keeps tracks of how many consecutive games the same two players have played against each other .
        Parameters:
        roundCount - holds the value of type int of how many rounds the same two players have played against each other.

      • incrementRoundCount

        public static void incrementRoundCount()
        Call this method to increment the value for round count by +1, instead of using the setter method every time.

      • playMove

        public static void playMove(int x,
                            int y)
                     throws IllegalMove,
                            WinAndLosses
        This method will handle any request by the GUI to place a piece on the board at the given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - is a variable of type int that represents the row (x coordinate) of the square on the board.
        y - is a variable of type int that represents the column (y coordinate) of the square on the board.
        Throws:
        IllegalMove
        WinAndLosses

      • setupPlayerStats

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> setupPlayerStats()
        call this method to get an ArrayList of type containing all the player stats for player one and player two, aggregating them together in a single array. Player should have a method that does this for each player.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of type containing the player stats for both players

      • setupGameBoard

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<javafx.scene.control.Button>> setupGameBoard()
        Call this method to setup a new empty 2D ArrayList of type
        Returns:

      • resetGame

        public static void resetGame()
        Call this method to reset the board once the user(s) have confirmed to play an other round
